v.v: Yahweh is my light and my salvation;
When evildoers approached me to devour my flesh,
Though an army encamps against me,
One thing have I asked of Yahweh, and I will seek that:
For in the day of trouble he will hide me in his shelter;
Then my head will be lifted up above my enemies all around me,
Hear, Yahweh, my voice when I cry out!
Do not hide your face from me;
Even if my father and my mother forsake me,
Do not give me up to the desires of my enemies,
What would have happened to me if I had not believed that I would see the goodness of Yahweh in the land of the living?

v: whom should I fear?
Yahweh is my life’s refuge;
whom should I dread?
my adversaries and my enemies stumbled and fell.
my heart will not fear;
though war rises up against me,
even then I will remain confident.
that I may live in the house of Yahweh all the days of my life,
to see the beauty of Yahweh
and to meditate in his temple.
in the cover of his tent he will conceal me.
He will lift me high on a rock!
and I will offer sacrifices of joy in his tent!
I will sing and make songs to Yahweh!
Have mercy on me, and answer me!
“Seek his face!” I seek your face, Yahweh!
do not turn your servant away in anger!
You have been my helper;
do not forsake me or abandon me, God of my salvation!
Yahweh will take me in.
Lead me on a level path
because of my enemies.
for false witnesses have risen up against me,
and they breathe out violence!
be strong, and let your heart be courageous!
Wait for Yahweh!
